intro: Capnoides rutifolia, commonly known as the redroot sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a reddish tint, especially when young. Capnoides rutifolia is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
